head.title: Raider Learning Opportunities During Closure - Woodbridge Raiders

a.span: Archived Raider Learning Opportunities During Closure

div.div:
​Dear Woodbridge Families / Caregivers
Thank you for your understanding, patience and flexibility during this unusual time that schools are closed due to COVID19. We understand that our WSD families are managing a lot and that the safety and welfare of family is paramount. We also know that you are committed to partnering with the Woodbridge staff in supporting your child's learning. Our teachers and paras are so excited to get back in touch with you over the next several weeks as we continue to add to our Remote Learning Plan. We will continue to offer two learning opportunities: Online Learning and Hard Copy Packets (if your household does not have access to the internet or computerized devices). Learning Opportunities comprise review, practice, and preview of essential skills and knowledge from the school year. A brief description of each follows:
Learning Opportunity #1 - Students will have access to online / computerized programs (Edmentum and others) where
assignments from various content areas have been assigned to them. Students can log into
these programs using their Clever Account information and any computerized device (laptop, IPad
/Tablet, Smartphone). Your child will be familiar with these programs as they are used on a
regular basis when in school.
Directions for how your child may access their Clever account are with the tab below, "How to
Login with Clever".
Learning Opportunity #2 - Students without Internet Access and/or devices will have access to hard copy paper packets that
are the same or similar to the online versions of learning assignments. Students can work at
their own pace and receive support from family, teachers, and other learning friends.
Students will be able to obtain these packets by contacting their schools for the process to
receive instruction.
We do realize that some of our students do not have computers or internet service to access some of the resources listed. We
​also know that it may be difficult to pick up instructional packets. Try not to worry if either is the case for your family. We will
do all we can to reach out to you to see how we can help.
We encourage you to participate in the instructional activities provided but also know that these learning
opportunities will be non-evaluative during this time or upon the return to school.
Thank you for your continued support as we work to provide our students the best possible educational resources during this time of closure.

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

font.font: Week of April 20-24: Keep up the great work!

br.font: Reading, Math, Science, Social Studies and Related Arts are together for each grade listed below. Student Support areas have provided additional or supplemental guidance and instruction. Students have also been assigned Math work in Edmentum and other subject sites if they can do work online and each student will be getting one of their Booksworms popular stories or other readings in the mail to go along with reading assignments.

a.span: K. Smith and B. Widerman Classes

br.font:
Reading, Math, Science, and Social Studies are together for each grade listed below. Related Arts and Student Support Areas
have provided additional and supplemental instruction.
br.span: Students have also been assigned Math work in Edmentum and other subject sites if they can do work online and each student will be getting one of their Booksworms popular stories in the mail to go along with reading assignments.

br.font: Students have been assigned a course for each of the courses in their schedule through Edmentum Courseware Library. Students that do not have internet / computer device can obtain the following Instructional Packets that have been developed to review, practice and preview of essential skills and knowledge.
